subject: p11540283
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study,. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Pacer lead is in a standard position in the right ventricle. NG tube tip is out of view below the diaphragm. ET tube tip is in standard position. There is no pneumothorax or large effusion. Patient is status post CABG. Mild vascular congestion has minimally improved. Increasing opacities in the lower lobes, left greater than right are consistent with worsening atelectasis, aspiration cannot be totally excluded.
